Grouped_Utterances: I’d like to explore how to handle disagreements better, especially when we’re both stressed.

There were a couple of times we slipped back into old habits, but we caught ourselves quickly. We’ve tried taking breaks to cool down before discussing things, which helps. Sometimes it’s hard to remember to take a break when emotions run high.

Hi, Ellie! Things have been pretty good. We’ve been celebrating our daughter’s little wins, and it seems to be working. She’s been really excited about it. It’s motivated her to try harder in school. Yes, she seems more engaged and willing to ask for help when she needs it. I feel proud. It’s nice to see her responding positively to our efforts. Yes, we’ve been trying to communicate better. I’ve been more open about my feelings, and it’s helped. She’s been receptive and has opened up more as well. It feels like we’re on the same team now. I think being aware of our goals has kept us focused. Plus, we remind each other to stay on track.
I’ve been trying to exercise more. It helps clear my mind. It’s been good! I feel more energized and focused after a workout.

That could work! It would be a gentle reminder without escalating things. Maybe something simple like “Let’s take a moment” would be good. I think it’ll help a lot. It’ll give us both a moment to breathe.
That’s perfectly okay! It’s important to take things one step at a time. For our next session, we can check in on how the strategies are working and explore any new challenges that arise.
